title: Three-day int’l conference on ‘Promoting South Asia Regional Cooperation in Higher Education’ concluded
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jan 17 (APP): The three-day international conference titled “Promoting South Asia Regional Cooperation in Higher Education”, was concluded here Friday.
On the third day, Prof. Dr. Muhammad Kamran, Vice Chancellor, Islamia University of Bahawalpur and MNS University of Engineering and Technology Multan interacted with various national and international delegates participating in the Higher Education Development in Pakistan Project Forum organized by the Higher Education Commission of Pakistan, said a press release.
Prof. Dr. Muhammad Kamran met with Prof. Dr. Muhammad Mukhtar, Vice Chancellor, National Skills University Islamabad, Prof. Dr. Saeed Ahmad Buzdar, Vice Chancellor, Thal University Bhakkar, and Dr. Shoab A.Khan, Chancellor, Sir Syed CASE Institute of Technology Islamabad, a renowned researcher and innovator in electrical engineering, discussed mutual cooperation and collaboration for academic excellence.
